ROLEPLAY SCRIPT: Patient with Unicystic Ameloblastoma
You are a 28-year-old biological male.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- A painless swelling in your lower jaw that you noticed a few weeks ago.
- Recently, you've started feeling a dull ache or slight pain in the same area.
- You also notice a small, firm lump inside your cheek, which feels like tucked-in nuts or small balls.
- The swelling is only on the right side of your face and has gradually become more noticeable.
- You haven't experienced any numbness or significant changes in your teeth or gums.
These symptoms came into fruition gradually over the past month. You first noticed the swelling, which was painless, but over time, you began feeling mild discomfort and the lump became more prominent. You are concerned because the swelling seems to be growing slowly but steadily, and you're worried about what it could be.

It’s not really painful most of the time, just a dull ache sometimes, and I found a small lump inside my cheek. I thought it was probably nothing, but it’s been bothering me enough that I decided to come in.
